description: Our modernisation plan to transform customer service in our Tube stations

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["Our modernisation plans are transforming customer service on the Tube. We are taking feedback on board and looking for new ways to improve our customer service."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}

All stations will continue to remain staffed at all times, and there will be more staff available to offer assistance to customers where it is needed most. We are phasing the station changes so that any major events and engineering works are avoided.

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["All our station staff  receive customer service training and  are equipped with handheld devices loaded with information to help customers get around, including maps, live service levels, Journey Planner, ticketing options and prices and local information","Staff training includes elements designed and delivered by disabled people on how best to assist disabled customers. Find out about this accessibility training in our film"]}

For more details, see our guide on other ways of buying tickets and getting information .
We have worked to make the best use of station space and improve facilities for staff and customers including:
